text:
The marsh swells around your legs like a grasping hand. Blackened reeds part reluctantly as you move, disturbed by your very presence. Strange shapes drift beneath the surface—some bones, some perhaps not. The cries of unseen birds echo like mourning hymns across the stagnant waters.

Ancient stone altars lie half-submerged, covered in glyphs that pulse faintly when you near. The marsh remembers those who came before, and it does not welcome you. Far off, a ripple cuts across the water—too large for any natural beast. Something waits, beneath the veil of rot.
lore: The Weeping Marsh was once known as the Vale of Vows, where the Moss-Priests gave up their names to feed the First Flame. Their altars now weep for what was lost, and whisper only to the forgotten.
